meanings.definition: Perforated or porous, like a sieve.
meanings.sent1: The cribriform screen allowed the cool breeze to pass through easily.
meanings.sent2: The cribriform sponge absorbed water quickly due to its many tiny holes.
meanings.sent3: The cribriform pastry cutter made the cookies look like lace doilies.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt cribriform, letting ideas flow in and out effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The cribriform clouds in the sky resembled delicate lace patterns.

meanings.sent1: The cribriform fabric was perfect for a summer dress, allowing air to circulate.
meanings.sent2: The cribriform strainer drained the pasta quickly, leaving no water behind.
meanings.sent3: The cribriform paper lanterns cast beautiful patterns of light on the walls.
meanings.sent4: His excuses were as cribriform as a sieve, letting the truth slip through.
meanings.sent5: The cribriform fence provided a glimpse of the garden beyond.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to a structure resembling a sieve.
meanings.sent1: The cribriform design of the building allowed natural light to filter through.
meanings.sent2: The cribriform pattern on the window glass created a dappled effect indoors.
meanings.sent3: The cribriform cake mold made a unique pattern on the dessert.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were cribriform, sifting through memories like a sieve.
meanings.sent5: The cribriform architecture of the bridge was both functional and beautiful.
